metadata.job_to_be_done: Identify major usability pain points for users with visual impairments and propose actionable interface improvements to meet accessibility standards.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Visually impaired users reported difficulties with low contrast text, lack of descriptive labels, and screen reader incompatibility. Font sizes were not adjustable, and users struggled with navigation.
The application failed WCAG 2.1 criteria in multiple areas: insufficient contrast ratios (1.4.3), missing accessible names (4.1.2), and lack of support for text resizing (1.4.4).
Recommendations include adding screen reader labels to all interactive elements, increasing tap target sizes, supporting dynamic text resizing, and ensuring contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards.
"I couldn’t find the 'Pay' button using VoiceOver." — This quote highlights the importance of proper element labeling for accessibility APIs.
Improving tab order and providing alternate text for icons are essential fixes. Also, visual cues must be accompanied by screen reader-friendly messaging.
